GENERAL STAFF, INDIA. 1924 SIMLA MANAGER, GOVERNMENT OF INDIA PRESS 1924Corrections and Additions. WHO’S WHD IN PERSIA, VOL. III. 7.—After entry/or AZAD-UD-DOWLEII add :~ BAHADUR SULTAN—hereditary kalantar of the Zanawafc half of Behbehan town—officiated for Zia-us-Sultan as Governor of Behbehan and Kuhgalu December 1923. Page 13.—After the entry/or CHIRAGH ALI KHAN add :— ENTEZAM-UD-DOWLEH Governor of Kashan. Dis missed September 1923. Page 17 .—To the entry for HAIDAR QULI KHAN add :— Chief of Staff Isfahan. Reported in July 1923 that he had been succeeded by Muhammad Hassan Mirza [q. u), M C-51-C. G. S.2 Jpage 17.—After the entry for HAZI ABDUR KARIM KHAN add • HAJI KHAN, Shiri'ani started a new party of democrats in Isfahan under name of “ Independent Democrats.” Intends publishing a newspaper under name of ‘'Kanin.' Is brother of editor of Tehran paper “ Milan Page 18.—After the entry for HAJI MUHAMMAD ALI add HASS AN ALI MIRZA son of the late Agha Najafi and nephew of Nurulla. page 21.—After the entiy or JAVAD KHAN (2) aM -:— JELA-US-SALTANEH Chief of Municipality Isfahan! arrived 3rd August 1923. Page 24.—After the entry/or MIRZA ABDULLAH MUSTOUFI add :— MIRZA MESSOUD KHAN ea-Govemor of KUMTSHEH Appointed governor of Ardestan January 1923. After the entry/or MIRZA MUHAMMAD KHAN add MISHKET-US-SULTAN deputy governor of Isfahan. Arrived from Tehran 20th September 1923. MUD1R-US-SULTAN (Haji) governor , of.Kumisheh. Re^ called August 1922,Page, 29.—After the entry for JAFAR SAIYID add :— MUHAMMAD HASS AN MIRZA—son of Farman Farma— reported in July 1923 that he had superseded Haidar Quli Khan as Chief of Stall Isfahan. Page 29.—After the entry for MULK ARA add :— MUSAVI ZADEH—editor of “ Shiyam '. Expelled from Tehran 1922 for defamatory publications re : Shah’s visit to Paris. Arrived Isfahan February 1923. MUSHAR-UD-DOULEH resigned Governor-Generalship of Arabistan October 1923. During his tenure of office he earned respect of all classes by his honesty and tact. Appointed Governor of Larek Khism and Hen jam February 1924: (see also Volume IV.) Page 35.—After the entry for REZA KHAN add :— RUKN-UL-VEZAREH—appointed Karguzar for Isfahan January 1924 : was previously Karguzar Isfahan 1923. Page 38.—After the entry for SARDAR-I-AKRAM add :— SARDAR ’1HTISAR—appointed Chief of Finance Office Isfahan, Vice Nefta-i-Lashkar March 1923.4 'Page —Tti the entry for SARDAR-I-JANC, line 7, for “ SARBAR-I-BAHADUR ” substitute “ SARDAR-I- ASSAD ”, Page 39.—After the entry for SARTIP KHAN add SARUSH—Chief of Indirect Taxes Isfahan. Transferred to Yezd July 1923. Page 42.—After the entry/or SULTAN ALI KHAN add :—- SULTAN ASADULLAH KHAN Formerly served in 2nd Cavalry S. P. R. Transferred from Gover norship of Kazerun to Acting Civil Governorship of Behbchan and Kuhgalu December 1923. Page 4$.—After the entry for SULTAN MUHAMMAD KHAN add :— TABIB ZADEH—appointed Chief of Indirect Taxes Mahan July 1923 vice SARUSH. Page 45.—After the entry for ZAHIR-UL-MULK add ZIA-UL-VAISIN editor of “ Iran-i-Auzad”. Expelled from Tehran 1922 for defamatory articles re: Shah’s visit to Europe. Arrived Isfahan February 1923.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Corrections and Additions to Who's Who in Persia, Vol. III'

physicalDescription.extent: The biographical entries are arranged in alphabetical order from front to back, with cross-references where required.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-6; these numbers are printed, and are not circled.

mods.abstract: The volume consists of corrections and additions to the biographical dictionary of individuals, families, and tribes given in Who's Who in Persia (Volume III) Arabistan, Luristan, Isfahan & Bakhtiari, compiled by the General Staff, India, from 1923.Published by the Manager, Government of India Press, Simla, 1924.
